materials.raw_text: C8 (Cobalt) - 15.0 g, Er (Erbium) - 10.0 g, Sc (Scandium) - 5.0 g, W (Tungsten) - 20.0 g, Binder (Polymer resin) - 50.0 g, Catalyst - 3.0 g

sourcing.instructions: Cobalt powder - chemical supply stores; Erbium powder - specialized metal suppliers; Scandium powder - rare earth metal suppliers; Tungsten powder - metallurgy suppliers; Polymer resin - craft stores or online; Catalyst - chemical supply stores.
steps: Cobalt powder - chemical supply stores; Erbium powder - specialized metal suppliers; Scandium powder - rare earth metal suppliers; Tungsten powder - metallurgy suppliers; Polymer resin - craft stores or online; Catalyst - chemical supply stores.

1. Weigh all ingredients accurately using a precision scale. 2. Combine Cobalt, Erbium, Scandium, and Tungsten powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Add the polymer resin and catalyst to the metal powder mixture. 4. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical stirrer for 10 minutes to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh all ingredients accurately using a precision scale. 2. Combine Cobalt, Erbium, Scandium, and Tungsten powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Add the polymer resin and catalyst to the metal powder mixture. 4. Mix thoroughly using a mechanical stirrer for 10 minutes to ensure even distribution.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800째C. 2. Place the mixed material in a heat-resistant mold suitable for the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Heat the mold in the furnace for 1 hour to ensure proper fusion of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800째C. 2. Place the mixed material in a heat-resistant mold suitable for the dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Heat the mold in the furnace for 1 hour to ensure proper fusion of materials.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Ensure that the cooling process takes at least 2 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. Ensure that the cooling process takes at least 2 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the mold. 2. Inspect for surface imperfections; if needed, sand down rough edges using fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and finish. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before use.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the mold. 2. Inspect for surface imperfections; if needed, sand down rough edges using fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and finish. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before use.
